cyclone.name: CHRIS
cyclone.current_location: about 145 mi SSE of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: meandering just off the North Carolina coast through the weekend, then accelerating northeastward away from the Mid-Atlantic coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: None – forecast keeps center offshore of the U.S. East Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect (interests along NC coast only advised to monitor)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Swells and rip currents expected along the North Carolina and Mid-Atlantic coasts, including Virginia beaches
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds possible late Sunday into Tuesday with low (≤12%) chance of sustained tropical-storm force (≥34 kt) conditions
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected – only elevated surf and rip currents
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate showers possible; heavy rainfall totals not anticipated
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents that could disrupt port small-craft operations
